The Duchess of Cambridge climbs out of a training aircraft during a visit to RAF Wittering Darren Staples/Reuters 13/13 
The Duchess of Cambridge climbs out of a training aircraft during a visit to RAF Wittering Darren Staples/Reuters 
The Duchess of Cambridge was in the cockpit today when she stepped in to a training aircraft during a visit to RAF Wittering. 
The 35-year-old royal grinned as training officers from the base near Peterborough showed her the ropes in the aircraft. 
Kate, who is Honorary Air Commandant of the RAF Air Cadets, met with cadets from Wing Air Training Corps in Bedfordshire and Cambridgeshire who were taking part in a half-term skills development camp. 
Cadet Sergeant Jordan Bertolaso, a qualified aerospace instructor, talked the Duchess though the controls of the Grob tutor, a light aircraft which cadets use each year for air experience. RAF Wittering: The Duchess sat in a training plane (Joe Giddens/PA) 
Cadet Sgt Bertolaso said: "It's incredible to have such a high-profile royal as our patron, especially as she has strong links to the Royal Air Force with her husband being a former pilot." Read more
